member.name: M:SampleLibraryUI.Examples.ButtonCustomNodeModel.#ctor
member.summary: The constructor for a NodeModel is used to create the input and output ports and specify the argument lacing. It gets invoked when the node is added to the graph from the library or through copy/paste.

member.name: M:SampleLibraryUI.Examples.ButtonCustomNodeModel.OnBuilt
member.summary: Register the data bridge callback.

member.name: M:SampleLibraryUI.Examples.ButtonCustomNodeModel.Dispose
member.summary: Unregister the data bridge callback.

member.name: M:SampleLibraryUI.Examples.ButtonCustomNodeModel.DataBridgeCallback(System.Object)
member.summary: Callback method for DataBridge mechanism. This callback only gets called when - The AST is executed - After the BuildOutputAST function is executed - The AST is fully built
member.param: The data passed through the data bridge.

member.name: M:SampleLibraryUI.Examples.ButtonCustomNodeModel.BuildOutputAst(System.Collections.Generic.List{ProtoCore.AST.AssociativeAST.AssociativeNode})
member.summary: BuildOutputAst is where the outputs of this node are calculated. This method is used to do the work that a compiler usually does by parsing the inputs List inputAstNodes into an abstract syntax tree.

member.name: T:SampleLibraryUI.Examples.ButtonCustomNodeModelNodeViewCustomization
member.summary: View customizer for CustomNodeModel Node Model.

member.name: M:SampleLibraryUI.Examples.ButtonCustomNodeModelNodeViewCustomization.CustomizeView(SampleLibraryUI.Examples.ButtonCustomNodeModel,Dynamo.Controls.NodeView)
member.summary: At run-time, this method is called during the node creation. Here you can create custom UI elements and add them to the node view, but we recommend designing your UI declaratively using xaml, and binding it to properties on this node as the DataContext.
member.param: The NodeModel representing the node's core logic.
The NodeView representing the node in the graph.

member.name: M:SampleLibraryUI.Examples.ButtonCustomNodeModelNodeViewCustomization.Dispose
member.summary: Here you can do any cleanup you require if you've assigned callbacks for particular UI events on your node.
